materials_name: gelatin  paper (fibre product)  silver sulfide  baryta paper
object_work_type: black-and-white prints (photographs) gelatin silver prints  photographic prints
physical_appearance: This print is a pictorial of a young boy who is pointing to a tooth with his left pinky. He looks afar in a distance; attention turned away from the viewer. There is some discolouration on the four corners of the print, and the backing on which it is mounted on has brown spots as well. On the bottom right corner there is an RPS Associate 1957 embossed, and on the verso, the photographer's chop as well as the title of the work are found.
sgcool_label_text: Ho Koon Sang was a member of the Photographic Society of Singapore and an Associate of the Royal Photographic Society in London. This photograph was part of a set of 12 prints sent to the Royal Photographic Society in 1956.
subject_terms_1: teeth (animal components)  children (people by age group)
techniques_name: gelatin silver process photographic printing techniques black-and-white photography
